options.name: frequency_penalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: n
options.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt. Note: Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop.

options.name: presence_penalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

options.name: topP
options.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

options.name: systemMessage
options.default:
Assistant is a large language model trained by OpenAI.

Assistant is designed to be able to assist with a wide range of tasks, from answering simple questions to providing in-depth explanations and discussions on a wide range of topics. As a language model, Assistant is able to generate human-like text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in natural-sounding conversations and provide responses that are coherent and relevant to the topic at hand.

Assistant is constantly learning and improving, and its capabilities are constantly evolving. It is able to process and understand large amounts of text, and can use this knowledge to provide accurate and informative responses to a wide range of questions. Additionally, Assistant is able to generate its own text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in discussions and provide explanations and descriptions on a wide range of topics.

Overall, Assistant is a powerful system that can help with a wide range of tasks and provide valuable insights and information on a wide range of topics. Whether you need help with a specific question or just want to have a conversation about a particular topic, Assistant is here to assist.
options.description: The message that will be sent to the agent before the conversation starts

options.description: Comma-separated list of tables to ignore from the database. If empty, no tables are ignored.

options.name: includedSampleRows
options.description: Number of sample rows to include in the prompt to the agent. It helps the agent to understand the schema of the database but it also increases the amount of tokens used.

options.name: includedTables
options.description: Comma-separated list of tables to include in the database. If empty, all tables are included.

options.name: prefixPrompt
options.default:
You are an agent designed to interact with an SQL database.
Given an input question, create a syntactically correct {dialect} query to run, then look at the results of the query and return the answer.
Unless the user specifies a specific number of examples they wish to obtain, always limit your query to at most {top_k} results using the LIMIT clause.
You can order the results by a relevant column to return the most interesting examples in the database.
Never query for all the columns from a specific table, only ask for a the few relevant columns given the question.
You have access to tools for interacting with the database.
Only use the below tools. Only use the information returned by the below tools to construct your final answer.
You MUST double check your query before executing it. If you get an error while executing a query, rewrite the query and try again.

DO NOT make any DML statements (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, DROP etc.) to the database.

If the question does not seem related to the database, just return "I don't know" as the answer.
options.description: Prefix prompt to use for the agent

options.name: suffixPrompt
options.description: Suffix prompt to use for the agent

options.name: topK
options.description: The maximum number of results to return

options.name: humanMessageTemplate
options.description: The message that will be sent to the agent during each step execution

options.name: Auto
options.description: Model will use the auto setting which will look at the image input size and decide if it should use the low or high setting

options.name: Low
options.description: The model will receive a low-res 512px x 512px version of the image, and represent the image with a budget of 65 tokens. This allows the API to return faster responses and consume fewer input tokens for use cases that do not require high detail.

options.name: High
options.description: Allows the model to see the low res image and then creates detailed crops of input images as 512px squares based on the input image size. Each of the detailed crops uses twice the token budget (65 tokens) for a total of 129 tokens.

model
properties.description: The name of the model(deployment) to use

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.

options.name: timeout
options.description: Maximum amount of time a request is allowed to take in milliseconds

options.name: maxRetries
options.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

name: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatOllama
description: Language Model Ollama

properties.displayName: This node must be connected to an AI chain. Insert one
properties.name: notice
model
properties.description: The model which will generate the completion. To download models, visit Ollama Models Library.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: temperature
options.description: Controls the randomness of the generated text. Lower values make the output more focused and deterministic, while higher values make it more diverse and random.

options.name: topK
options.description: Limits the number of highest probability vocabulary tokens to consider at each step. A higher value increases diversity but may reduce coherence. Set to -1 to disable.

options.name: topP
options.description: Chooses from the smallest possible set of tokens whose cumulative probability exceeds the probability top_p. Helps generate more human-like text by reducing repetitions.

options.name: frequencyPenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty for tokens that have already appeared in the generated text. Higher values discourage repetition.

options.name: keepAlive
options.description: Specifies the duration to keep the loaded model in memory after use. Useful for frequently used models. Format: 1h30m (1 hour 30 minutes).

options.name: lowVram
options.description: Whether to Activate low VRAM mode, which reduces memory usage at the cost of slower generation speed. Useful for GPUs with limited memory.

options.name: mainGpu
options.description: Specifies the ID of the GPU to use for the main computation. Only change this if you have multiple GPUs.

options.name: numBatch
options.description: Sets the batch size for prompt processing. Larger batch sizes may improve generation speed but increase memory usage.

options.name: numCtx
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to use as context for generating the next token. Smaller values reduce memory usage, while larger values provide more context to the model.

options.name: numGpu
options.description: Specifies the number of GPUs to use for parallel processing. Set to -1 for auto-detection.

options.name: numPredict
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to -1 for no limit. Be cautious when setting this to a large value, as it can lead to very long outputs.

options.name: numThread
options.description: Specifies the number of CPU threads to use for processing. Set to 0 for auto-detection.

options.name: penalizeNewline
options.description: Whether the model will be less likely to generate newline characters, encouraging longer continuous sequences of text

options.name: presencePenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty for tokens based on their presence in the generated text so far. Positive values penalize tokens that have already appeared, encouraging diversity.

options.name: repeatPenalty
options.description: Adjusts the penalty factor for repeated tokens. Higher values more strongly discourage repetition. Set to 1.0 to disable repetition penalty.

options.name: useMLock
options.description: Whether to lock the model in memory to prevent swapping. This can improve performance but requires sufficient available memory.

options.name: useMMap
options.description: Whether to use memory mapping for loading the model. This can reduce memory usage but may impact performance. Recommended to keep enabled.

options.name: vocabOnly
options.description: Whether to only load the model vocabulary without the weights. Useful for quickly testing tokenization.

options.name: format
options.description: Specifies the format of the API response

values.name: batchSize

options.name: maxTokens
options.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 32,768).

options.name: timeout
options.description: Maximum amount of time a request is allowed to take in milliseconds

options.name: maxRetries
options.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt

options.name: topP
options.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.
